top_categories.workout_context: At mile 60 of 100, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
Rock Cobbler's Central Valley gravel, Rocky sections forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 100 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Rock Cobbler's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before February.
50ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Rock Cobbler, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Rock Cobbler. Train it until it feels boring.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 100 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
5,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
100 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Rock Cobbler, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 5,000ft of climbing on central Valley gravel and dirt—rocks, rollers does to your power file on race day.
5,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.

race_overlay.heat: February in Bakersfield, California can bring heat. Complete 3–4 heat exposure sessions in the final 2 weeks before Rock Cobbler. Increase sodium intake 48 hours before race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Rock Cobbler’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Rock Cobbler requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on central valley gravel and dirt—rocks, rollers to build confidence. Expect: central valley gravel, rocky sections, dirt roads.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 100 miles of central valley gravel and dirt—rocks, rollers in Bakersfield, California.
